meanings.definition: A person who is dishonest or untrustworthy.
meanings.sent1: That skelm stole my lunch money!
meanings.sent2: I don't trust that skelm with my secrets.
meanings.sent3: The skelm tried to sneak away with the cookies.
meanings.sent4: Beware of the skelm in sheep's clothing.
meanings.sent5: The town was full of skelms, always looking for trouble.

meanings.definition: To act in a sneaky or underhanded manner.
meanings.sent1: He likes to skelm around in the shadows.
meanings.sent2: Don't skelm your way out of taking responsibility.
meanings.sent3: She tried to skelm her way into getting extra credit.
meanings.sent4: The cat skelmed its way into the pantry for a midnight snack.
meanings.sent5: The spy skelmed through the security system undetected.
